column4: hi people, i tried to implement thin client but i found an error in installing ltsp-client-core, it says cannot be installed on this regular machine, how do i fix this?
which command did you run exactly?
when i tried to install openssh-server
we need to know the exact commands you entered, otherwise we will not be able to help
moldy the client can now receive the ip address from the server but it seems it fails on TFTP
check your server-side tftp logs
what directory and what file? sorry im new to networking
do i need also to modify /etc/network/interface? do i need to assign IP address on their?
usually not
i'd run tftpd in the foreground to see what is going on
stop the running tftpd, then run "tftpd -L"
ah ok, again, so its just fine if i dont assign any IP on interface?
no, your server must have an ip address, of course
and it must be a fixed one
it does not matter *how* the server gets the address, but it must have one
it seems that error comes out when i tried to install openssh-server, it came out that blue dialog box, and displays ltsp-client-core cannot be installed on this machine
you still did not give me the exact commands you were running. i cannot help without them.
i see, so that means on example eth0, i will assign a fixed IP address
i have no idea where, why and how you were trying  to install openssh-server
i cannot help you if you don't give me more exact information
its alright, sorry i can no longer try it again, im no longer in the lab, but what i remember example when i try this command sudo apt-get install openssh-server, thats all
seems this command ltsp-update-sshkeys, i remember when i type that it seems that i wasnt install something like that
